content:
SystemPens Class

Definition

Each property of the SystemPens class is a Pen that is the color of a Windows display element and that has a width of 1 pixel.

In this Article

public sealed class SystemPens
Inheritance
Object
SystemPens

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Examples

The following code example creates points and sizes using several of the overloaded operators defined for these types. It also demonstrates how to use the SystemPens class.

This example is designed to be used with Windows Forms. Create a form that contains a Button named subtractButton. Paste the code into the form and call the CreatePointsAndSizes method from the form's Paint event-handling method, passing e as PaintEventArgs. 

private void CreatePointsAndSizes(PaintEventArgs e)
{

    // Create the starting point.
    Point startPoint = new Point(subtractButton.Size);

    // Use the addition operator to get the end point.
    Point endPoint = startPoint + new Size(140, 150);

    // Draw a line between the points.
    e.Graphics.DrawLine(SystemPens.Highlight, startPoint, endPoint);

    // Convert the starting point to a size and compare it to the
    // subtractButton size.  
    Size buttonSize = (Size)startPoint;
    if (buttonSize == subtractButton.Size)

        // If the sizes are equal, tell the user.
    {
        e.Graphics.DrawString("The sizes are equal.", 
            new Font(this.Font, FontStyle.Italic), 
            Brushes.Indigo, 10.0F, 65.0F);
    }

}

void CreatePointsAndSizes( PaintEventArgs^ e )
{
   // Create the starting point.
   Point startPoint = Point(subtractButton->Size);
   
   // Use the addition operator to get the end point.
   Point endPoint = startPoint + System::Drawing::Size( 140, 150 );
   
   // Draw a line between the points.
   e->Graphics->DrawLine( SystemPens::Highlight, startPoint, endPoint );
   
   // Convert the starting point to a size and compare it to the
   // subtractButton size.  
   System::Drawing::Size buttonSize = (System::Drawing::Size)startPoint;
   if ( buttonSize == subtractButton->Size )
   {
      e->Graphics->DrawString( "The sizes are equal.", gcnew System::Drawing::Font( this->Font,FontStyle::Italic ), Brushes::Indigo, 10.0F, 65.0F );
   }
}

Private Sub CreatePointsAndSizes(ByVal e As PaintEventArgs)

    ' Create the starting point.
    Dim startPoint As New Point(subtractButton.Size)

    ' Use the addition operator to get the end point.
    Dim endPoint As Point = Point.op_Addition(startPoint, _
        New Size(140, 150))

    ' Draw a line between the points.
    e.Graphics.DrawLine(SystemPens.Highlight, startPoint, endPoint)

    ' Convert the starting point to a size and compare it to the
    ' subtractButton size.  
    Dim buttonSize As Size = Point.op_Explicit(startPoint)
    If (Size.op_Equality(buttonSize, subtractButton.Size)) Then

        ' If the sizes are equal, tell the user.
        e.Graphics.DrawString("The sizes are equal.", _
            New Font(Me.Font, FontStyle.Italic), _
            Brushes.Indigo, 10.0F, 65.0F)
    End If

End Sub

Properties

ActiveBorder

Gets a Pen that is the color of the active window's border.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ActiveBorder { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the active window's border.

ActiveCaption

Gets a Pen that is the color of the background of the active window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ActiveCaption { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the background of the active window's title bar.

ActiveCaptionText

Gets a Pen that is the color of the text in the active window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ActiveCaptionText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the text in the active window's title bar.

AppWorkspace

Gets a Pen that is the color of the application workspace.

public static System.Drawing.Pen AppWorkspace { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the application workspace.

Remarks

The application workspace is the area in a multiple document view that is not being occupied by documents.

ButtonFace

Gets a Pen that is the face color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ButtonFace { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the face color of a 3-D element.

ButtonHighlight

Gets a Pen that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ButtonHighlight { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face the light source.

ButtonShadow

Gets a Pen that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ButtonShadow { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face away from the light source.

Control

Gets a Pen that is the face color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen Control { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the face color of a 3-D element.

ControlDark

Gets a Pen that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ControlDark { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face away from the light source.

ControlDarkDark

Gets a Pen that is the dark shadow color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ControlDarkDark { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the dark shadow color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to the parts of a 3-D element that are the darkest color.

ControlLight

Gets a Pen that is the light color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ControlLight { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the light color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face the light source.

ControlLightLight

Gets a Pen that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ControlLightLight { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to the parts of a 3-D element that are the lightest color.

ControlText

Gets a Pen that is the color of text in a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ControlText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of text in a 3-D element.

Desktop

Gets a Pen that is the color of the Windows desktop.

public static System.Drawing.Pen Desktop { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the Windows desktop.

GradientActiveCaption

Gets a Pen that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Pen GradientActiveCaption { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar.

GradientInactiveCaption

Gets a Pen that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Pen GradientInactiveCaption { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar.

GrayText

Gets a Pen that is the color of dimmed text.

public static System.Drawing.Pen GrayText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of dimmed text.

Remarks

Items in a list that are disabled are displayed in dimmed text.

Highlight

Gets a Pen that is the color of the background of selected items.

public static System.Drawing.Pen Highlight { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the background of selected items.

Remarks

Selected items may include menu items as well as selected text. For example, the pen may be the color used for the background of selected items in a list box.

HighlightText

Gets a Pen that is the color of the text of selected items.

public static System.Drawing.Pen HighlightText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the text of selected items.

Remarks

Selected items may include menu items as well as selected text. For example, the pen may be the color used for the text of selected items in a list box.

HotTrack

Gets a Pen that is the color used to designate a hot-tracked item.

public static System.Drawing.Pen HotTrack { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color used to designate a hot-tracked item.

InactiveBorder

Gets a Pen is the color of the border of an inactive window.

public static System.Drawing.Pen InactiveBorder { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the border of an inactive window.

InactiveCaption

Gets a Pen that is the color of the title bar caption of an inactive window.

public static System.Drawing.Pen InactiveCaption { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the title bar caption of an inactive window.

InactiveCaptionText

Gets a Pen that is the color of the text in an inactive window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Pen InactiveCaptionText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the text in an inactive window's title bar.

Info

Gets a Pen that is the color of the background of a ToolTip.

public static System.Drawing.Pen Info { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the background of a ToolTip.

InfoText

Gets a Pen that is the color of the text of a ToolTip.

public static System.Drawing.Pen InfoText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the text of a ToolTip.

Menu

Gets a Pen that is the color of a menu's background.

public static System.Drawing.Pen Menu { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of a menu's background.

MenuBar

Gets a Pen that is the color of the background of a menu bar.

public static System.Drawing.Pen MenuBar { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the background of a menu bar.

MenuHighlight

Gets a Pen that is the color used to highlight menu items when the menu appears as a flat menu.

public static System.Drawing.Pen MenuHighlight { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color used to highlight menu items when the menu appears as a flat menu.

MenuText

Gets a Pen that is the color of a menu's text.

public static System.Drawing.Pen MenuText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of a menu's text.

ScrollBar

Gets a Pen that is the color of the background of a scroll bar.

public static System.Drawing.Pen ScrollBar { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the background of a scroll bar.

Window

Gets a Pen that is the color of the background in the client area of a window.

public static System.Drawing.Pen Window { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the background in the client area of a window.

WindowFrame

Gets a Pen that is the color of a window frame.

public static System.Drawing.Pen WindowFrame { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of a window frame.

WindowText

Gets a Pen that is the color of the text in the client area of a window.

public static System.Drawing.Pen WindowText { get; }
Value
Pen

A Pen that is the color of the text in the client area of a window.

Methods

FromSystemColor(Color)

Creates a Pen from the specified Color.

public static System.Drawing.Pen FromSystemColor (System.Drawing.Color c);
Parameters
c
Color

The Color for the new Pen.

Returns
Pen

The Pen this method creates.
